info.name: GoodLeap - Developer API
info.description:
The Developer API is designed for partners to originate  
and manage loans through their lifecycle.

To use this library you must first be gratned credentials and access to developer.goodleap.com.

request.description: Get a list of connected organizations.
Returns an elevated access token with Guest claims from an input host organization.
Create a refreshed elevated jwt token with Guest claims from a host organization.
Get a list of connected parties.

Get a collection of valid states for the client. 
Useful when searching for offers that are available to an applicant in their state.

Get a collection of valid channels for the client. 
Useful when searching for offers that are available to an applicant given a channel under which the client
wishes to operate.
Returns a collection of promotions to use when getting offers.
Returns a collection of categories.

item.name: All Loan min/max values for states and categories

request.description: Get categories limitations

item.name: Loan min/max values by category ID

request.description: Get category limitations
Returns a collection of Offers.
Get the current ITC percentage.
Calculate estimated payments for offers.
Get a list of available disclosures.
Submit an application to create a new loan. Returns the application’s outcome
Returns the url and an optional email to the application for completion and loan submission.
Get the details of a Loan instance.

Get the current timestamps for the loan. 
This can include milestones, document signing, approval status and more.
Get the details of the current offer associated with a loan ID.
Get a list of loans submitted by the client.
Get the loan timeline.
Get the next actions for a loan.
Returns a collection of cases.
Get a single-use, signed URL to upload a case document.
Get a single-use, signed URL to upload a case document.

item.name: Update Sales Rep State License Info

request.description: Update a loan’s case information.
URL redirect to the GoodLeap hosted borrower upload experience to upload documents for cases.

query.description: The type of the document to be scanned
The phone number to send the SMS to
Indicates if an SMS should be sent

request.description: Get a single-use, signed URL to upload a case document.
Get a single-use, signed URL to upload a case document.

A successful request will result in loan documents being sent to the borrower(s). 
This can happen as one of two scenarios:
1. If loan documents have yet to be signed, unsigned documents are sent.
2. If loan documents have already been signed, a copy of the signed documents are re-sent. 
   The loan’s status will remain untouched.
Confirm the amount and offer of the loan.
Get the loan's projects types.
Get the loan's project details.
Get the loan's project details.
Get a list of components with approved manufacturers.
Update a loan’s projects information.

item.name: Send Certificate of Project Completion (CPC) - HI only

request.description: Sends loan CPC
Transition a loan to a client-provided milestone.
Returns a collection of Offers.

Submit a change order to update the amount, offer, or enrollments on a loan.
Note: Once a loan has been funded, Autopay enrollment can no longer be managed via API.

Submit a cancellation for a given loan. 
In order to successfully cancel the loan, it must not be in the following states:
- Have a status of `DECLINED`, `CANCELLED`, or `FUNDED`
- Reached the Notice To Proceed (NTP) milestone
Get list of all notes associated with a loan and its cases.
Get list of all notes associated with a loan and its cases by reference.
Post a note to a loan and optionally its cases.
Add loan tags to a loan.
Delete loan tags from a loan.
Returns a user by Id
Create a user
Returns a collection of users belonging to the requesting organization.
Retrieve the possible list of roles and channels that are required for user creation.
Update user license by id
Update a user’s role.
Update user information by id
Update a user’s channels.

item.name: Toolbox
item.description: The Toolbox API will allow users in our sandbox environment to complete actions that would otherwise require GoodLeap team member involvement in the production environment and allow you to test your integration end-to-end.
